interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/06/29 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rose Bosch'], 'Producers': ['Jean-Robert Gibard', 'Alain Goldman', 'Catherine Morisse', 'Christer von Lindequist'], 'Starring': ['Jean Reno', 'Melanie Laurent', 'Gad Elmaleh'], 'Studio': ['Menemsha Films']} Review Text: An explicit historical account of the Velodrome d'hiver Round up (La Rafle) in Paris where thousands of Jews were arrested in mass and placed in extremely crowded conditions at the velodrome.
A very emotional film depicting the horror of mass murder of innocent people in transit to Auschwitz.
Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Highly recommended for those interested in historical drama. Review Title: Emotional Account of the Vel D'Hiver Round up in Paris Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
{'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Terry McDonagh'], 'Starring': ['Ray Winstone', 'Suranne Jones'], 'Studio': ['FilmRise']} On a whim, I came across this British mystery series and decided to watch. I'm on the 2nd season and have thoroughly enjoyed the series ... it's too bad that it ends with 2nd season. would've been nice to have more added. On a whim {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Byrum Geisler'], 'Producers': ['Brandon Garza', 'Alex Bice', 'Wes Ross'], 'Starring': ['Ethan Sharrett', 'Chase Conner', 'Brandi Price'], 'Studio': ['Washington House']} I decided to give this film 5 stars because of the movie's themes even though the story was somewhat slow to develop. These are new actors that I wasn't familiar with but I especially developed a strong bond with Ben Bennett. You could see how much he wanted to tell Lee about his feelings but was afraid to do so.
The film deals with the real problems that a relationship like this one can bring. It was moving to see a happy ending like this one. Makes You Think {'Content advisory': ['Smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John Korty', 'Arthur Hiller'], 'Producers': ['David Golden', 'Howard G. Minsky'], 'Starring': ['Ali MacGraw', "Ryan O'Neal", 'John Marley'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} I watched this in 1970 & loved it. Now 49 yrs later, it still has the same effect ... a universal love theme with a sad ending. superb acting by R. O'Neal and A. McGraw Epic Love Story {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Alejandro Bazzano'], 'Producers': ['Nacho Manubens', 'Sonia Martinez', 'Josep Cister Rubio', 'Aitor Montanchez'], 'Starring': ['Miguel angel Muñoz', 'Susi Sanchez', 'Elvira Minguez'], 'Studio': ['Atresmedia Television']} This was one of the best productions I've seen from Spain. Beautiful cinematography and breathtaking scenes of the Basque country. One of the reasons I chose to watch it is just that to see the country scenes. This seems to be a "film noir" type with a good plot and an unexpected ending. All new actors for me however, I had seen Susi Sanchez acting in a previous Spanish film. The only thing that I felt was NOT NECESSARY were all the sex scenes in the earlier episodes ... don't believe this contributed to the plot or if they had to throw in sex, the directors could have given it a "softer" touch ... I didn't dock any stars for that though. For those language fans out there, there's a lot of the Basque language you see in the film ... and I picked up some of the simpler Basque greetings. Recommended for mature audiences. Good Acting and Unexpected Ending Ashes in the Snow Historical, Romance, Downbeat, Emotional ["During World War II, a 16 year-old aspiring artist and her family are deported to Siberia amidst Stalin's brutal dismantling of the Baltic region. One girl's passion for art and her never-ending hope will break the silence of history."] {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marius Markevicius'], 'Producers': ['Marius Markevicius', 'Zilvinas Naujokas', 'Chris Coen', 'Prithvi Chavan'], 'Starring': ['Bel Powley', 'Sophia Cookson', 'Lisa Loven Kongsli']} If I could give this 10 stars I would. I always enjoy historical films and I was blown away by this film. Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Although it had some violent scenes, I believe the film conveyed the message how these innocent families struggled, survived and perished under Stalin's rule. Recommended for those interested in history. Extraordinary historical account {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rose Bosch'], 'Producers': ['Jean-Robert Gibard', 'Alain Goldman', 'Catherine Morisse', 'Christer von Lindequist'], 'Starring': ['Jean Reno', 'Melanie Laurent', 'Gad Elmaleh'], 'Studio': ['Menemsha Films']} An explicit historical account of the Velodrome d'hiver Round up (La Rafle) in Paris where thousands of Jews were arrested in mass and placed in extremely crowded conditions at the velodrome.
A very emotional film depicting the horror of mass murder of innocent people in transit to Auschwitz.
Beautiful cinematography and outstanding acting. Highly recommended for those interested in historical drama. Emotional Account of the Vel D'Hiver Round up in Paris
profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user continues to enjoy British mystery series and has a strong interest in international productions, particularly those with beautiful cinematography and historical narratives. Character-driven storytelling is a key focus, especially in films exploring themes of love and emotional depth, often with unexpected resolutions.

- **Engagement Style:** The user engages with both series and films spontaneously, increasingly favoring narratives that evoke strong emotional responses. They appreciate a range of genres, particularly those with historical contexts and compelling character development.

- **Viewing Habits:** Invested in longer series while also enjoying standalone films that deeply explore characters and convey significant emotional weight. The user values narratives that feature unique cultural elements and thoughtful conclusions.

- **Language:** Prefers content in English but is open to films in other languages, utilizing subtitles for enhanced engagement.

- **Emotional Response:** Shows a profound appreciation for storytelling, highlighting emotional complexity and visual beauty in reviews. The user is drawn to narratives that challenge conventional views on relationships, favoring both uplifting and bittersweet endings.

- **Rating Behavior:** Rates content variably (3.0 to 5.0), with recent ratings reflecting strong opinions on narrative quality and emotional impact. A recent 5-star rating emphasized a stark, emotionally charged historical drama with stunning cinematography and exceptional acting, showcasing the user's enthusiastic support for emotionally rich narratives.

Overall, the user demonstrates a clear affinity for intricate, emotional stories that blend mystery, history, and rich character development.
